description: Chipotle's CEO tells investors that the chain had not shrunk its portions despite accusations on Tiktok and Reddit. Brian Niccol has tried to bat down those complaints for weeks.
title: Chipotle is 're-emphasizing generous portions' after social-media complaints

description: A study of 48 post-mortem brains found a protein that appears to protect brain cells from Alzheimer's — even in people who had significant amounts of amyloid plaques in their brains.
title: Researchers have found a protein that seems to protect brain cells from Alzheimer's

description: Thousands of protesters marched near the U.S. Capitol to protest against the war in Gaza, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed Congress.
title: Thousands of protesters marched in D.C. ahead of Netanyahu's speech to Congress

description: The NBA signed its 11-year media rights deal with Disney, NBC and Amazon Prime Video after saying it was not accepting Warner Bros. Discovery’s offer to continue its longtime relationship with the league.
title: NBA signs media rights deal with Disney, NBC and Amazon, leaving TNT behind

description: In the Central Valley, California’s first new state park in a decade opened this summer and it re-imagines what a state park can be.
title: California's newest state park is like a time machine

description: President Biden has struggled with young voters. But now that he's out and Vice President Harris is in, younger voters are re-calculating.
title: How Gen-Z is feeling about Kamala Harris at the top of the ticket

description: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is meeting this week separately with President Biden and Vice President Harris. Wednesday afternoon, he addressed a joint meeting of Congress.
title: Netanyahu met with standing ovation and protest over joint meeting of Congress

description: The Northwest has been suffering record-setting heat. A cold front is supposed to move in, but with it comes high winds and dry thunderstorms in forests that have been cooked tinder dry.
title: A cold front is bringing some relief to the Northwest — but also wind

description: Coco Gauff the 23-year-old tennis player seemed floored today when she learned she'll be the first tennis player to have the honor of being flag bearer for the American team at the Paris Olympics.
title: Tennis player Coco Gauff is named as USA flag bearer for Olympics

description: The tennis star said he was advised by a doctor to sit out the Paris tournament after getting the diagnosis.
title: World No. 1 tennis player Jannik Sinner to sit out Paris Olympics due to illness

description: “I do worry that he is not helping further penetration of EVs into the car market” and might make people leery of buying a Tesla, an electric vehicle owner and enthusiast in Michigan tells NPR.
title: Elon Musk is backing Donald Trump. Could that hurt Tesla?

description: The United States men had not played at an Olympics since 2008. The squad opened the Paris Olympics by taking on host France in group play. The French easily defeated the Americans 3-0.
title: The U.S. men's soccer team opened the Paris Olympics with a tough loss against France

description: President Biden is giving an address from the Oval about how he will 'finish the job' — without a second term in office.
title: Biden to give Oval Office address on what's next

description: Israel's prime minister addresses Congress as Gaza's civilian death toll soars from Israeli airstrikes and the war grinds on for the tenth month.
title: This is what 10 months of war feels like to a family in Gaza

description: In Arizona, some voters worried former President Trump would reclaim the state he lost in 2020 breathed a sigh of relief on Sunday, when Biden announced he won’t accept the Democratic nomination.
title: The presidential candidacy of Kamala Harris could impact crucial swing state Arizona

description: The final results of a trial for a new HIV preventive strategy are out today. Experts express enthusiasm. But activists at the 2024 AIDS conference in Munich are protesting the likely cost.
title: New HIV preventive strategy sparks excitement -- and protests -- at AIDS conference

description: Cheaper versions of Wegovy and Zepbound touted on social media could be fleeting. Copies are legal now because the brand-name drugs are in short supply. But the drugmakers are boosting production.
title: Torrid market for copycat weight loss drugs could be short-lived

description: Fifteen years ago this Wednesday, the federal minimum wage went up from $6.55 per hour to $7.25. It hasn't budged since.
title: It has now been 15 years since the federal minimum rose to $7.25

description: The gunman who attempted to assassinate former President Donald Trump searched online about the 1963 assassination of President John F. Kennedy, the FBI director said.
title: FBI director says gunman at Trump rally searched for info on JFK assassination

description: Olympic surfing events are taking place in Teahupo’o, a small village nearly 9,800 miles from the host city of Paris. The path to Tahiti has been years in the making, and not without controversy.
title: Why Olympic surfing events are in Tahiti, thousands of miles from Paris

description: Families of hostages still being held in Gaza are hopeful Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu will announce a cease-fire deal that would bring the hostages home during his address to Congress Wednesday.
title: Relatives of Israeli hostages want cease-fire deal from Netanyahu speech

description: The 2024 Olympics kick off in Paris with a splashy opening ceremony on Friday and will run through Aug. 11. Here's how to keep up with the action, from primetime viewing to occasional scrolling.
title: Your guide to keeping up with the Paris Olympics

description: In a career marked by firsts, Harris is no stranger to charting a new path. If she becomes the Democratic nominee, and beats Trump in November, she would be the first woman president of the U.S.
title: As she is poised to be the Democratic nominee, here are 5 things about Kamala Harris

description: The U.S. wants changes to the World Anti-Doping Agency after a Chinese drug scandal. Olympic officials threatened to block Salt Lake City's bid to host the 2034 Games if the U.S. criticism persists.
title: Olympic officials try to crush U.S. probes of China doping, threaten Salt Lake Games

description: The Coast Guard said the two boaters were uninjured and their boat salvaged. They said the whale appeared to be uninjured.
title: A breaching whale capsized a boat, tossing 2 people overboard off New Hampshire coast

description: A NPR poll shows that newly undecided voters could be vital in Vice President Harris' campaign to win the 2024 election. And, NASA is hoping to save the most powerful X-ray telescope ever built.
title: Newly undecided voters could be crucial for Harris. And NASA races to save a telescope

description: Gauff, 20, is the first tennis player to serve as a U.S. flag bearer at an Olympic Games. At Friday's opening ceremony, she will carry the flag alongside basketball great LeBron James.
title: Tennis star Coco Gauff will carry the U.S. flag at the Olympic opening ceremony

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Democratic Sen. Bob Casey of Pennsylvania about what a Kamala Harris-led presidential ticket would mean for his state. President Biden ended his reelection bid on Sunday.
title: Democratic Sen. Bob Casey is up for reelection. Will the switch to Harris help him?

description: The host cities were elected just ahead of the start of the Paris Summer Games this week. The vote comes as finding host cities for the Winter Games has grown more challenging.
title: French Alps is chosen for the 2030 Winter Olympics, 2034 goes to Salt Lake City

description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Jaime Harrison, chair of the Democratic National Committee, about the party's plans to quickly nominate a new candidate for president. Biden dropped out on Sunday.
title: How the Democratic Party is managing a change in presidential candidates

description: The number of "unjust detentions" fell 42% over the last two years, according to the nonprofit Foley Foundation. Despite the progress, nations like Russia continue to pose major risks for U.S. travelers.
title: Diplomacy has reduced their numbers, but dozens of Americans are still detained abroad

description: A recent crop of human cases at a chicken farm highlight the risks of the ongoing outbreak. Here's what scientists fear could happen next in the evolution of the virus.
title: With the U.S. bird flu outbreak uncontained, scientists see growing risks

description: Bethel Park, Pa., is the hometown of Thomas Crooks, the 20-year-old who attempted to assassinate President Trump. In the wake of the shooting, residents there are shocked, but are recovering.
title: Neighbors in Bethel Park are still reeling from the Trump assassination attempt

description: Benjamin Netanyahu will speak to members of Congress on Wednesday. His words will be watched closely by family members of hostages and by a delegation of soldiers who have fought in Gaza since Oct. 7.
title: Netanyahu to deliver his 4th address to members of Congress

description: Pennsylvania is a swing state, site of the attempt on ex-President Trump's life, and home of a potential Democratic VP pick. We talk with activists in Pennsylvania about how it's all playing there.
title: Voters in the Pittsburgh suburbs react to the new Democratic presidential candidate

description: It has long been understood that photosynthesis creates oxygen, but researchers believe they've found oxygen being created in parts of the ocean with no light.
title: Scientists may have discovered 'dark oxygen' being created without photosynthesis

description: Vice President Harris is off and running. She will be in Indianapolis Wednesday, after her first big event in Milwaukee on Tuesday. Get caught up on the rapid-fire launch of this campaign.
title: Kamala Harris aims to define herself by campaigning across the country

description: A new sport, the return of in-person crowds, and a one-of-a-kind opening ceremony. Here's what to know about the start of the 2024 Summer Games in Paris.
title: 8 storylines to follow as the Paris Summer Olympics get underway

description: As Lilah Clevey pulled out of a gas station, she slammed into another car. The driver then became the unexpected source of comfort in Clevey's moment of panic.
title: She was 19 and caused a car crash. It was the other driver who came to her aid

description: IOC President Thomas Bach says Paris is ready to go for the 2024 Summer Olympics. But in speeches this week ahead of the Games, he warned that rising global tensions threaten the Olympic movement.
title: The Olympic president warns of perilous future for global sport as Paris Games begin

description: A large new study confirms what parents probably already suspect: Phones can keep tweens from getting a good night's sleep.
title: Tweens, screens and sleep: How parents can help kids get their zzzzz's

description: On a rocky hillside in Colorado is a “mega den” of hundreds of rattlesnakes — along with cameras livestreaming the whole thing.
title: Watch a livestream of Colorado’s ‘mega den’ of pregnant rattlesnakes

description: Maryland is poised to become the first state on the East Coast to enact safety protections for people working in the heat. It could be a model for a federal standard.
title: Maryland is set to finalize its heat standard for workers later this summer

description: Minnesota and Wisconsin are in contention. Minnesota is well known for being the 'Land of 10,000 Lakes.' Wisconsin is saying it has more.
title: Which state has more lakes: Minnesota or Wisconsin?

description: The protest Tuesday came a day before Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who faces criticism at home and abroad, is scheduled to address a joint meeting of Congress.
title: About 200 people protesting the war in Gaza arrested in Capitol building, police say

description: A survey from NPR/PBS News/Marist finds that most Americans think President Biden did the right thing by passing the torch to Vice President Harris, instead of continuing his bid for a second term.
title: More presidential voters are moving into the undecided camp, NPR Poll shows

description: A new report on Sudan from Doctors Without Borders reveals that civilians have little protection from indiscriminate attacks and sexual violence with very little aid able to enter the country.
title: Civilians in Sudan face violence from both warring sides, humanitarian group says

description: Israel's prime minister this afternoon speaks to a joint meeting of Congress. The rapid-fire launch of Kamala Harris' presidential campaign. And, the latest NPR political poll.
title: Morning news brief

description: Most states submitted plans to reduce planet-warming pollution to unlock federal grant money, and they proposed projects to get started. This week, the Biden administration announced the winners.
title: Here's how $4 billion in government money is being spent to reduce climate pollution

description: Christopher Dunn's situation is similar to that of Sandra Hemme, who spent 43 years in prison for the fatal stabbing of a woman in 1980 before her conviction was overturned.
title: A Missouri prison again has ignored an order to free a wrongfully convicted inmate

description: Mayall is credited with helping develop the English take on urban, Chicago-style rhythm and blues that played an important role in the blues revival of the late 1960s.
title: John Mayall, tireless and influential British blues pioneer, has died at 90

description: In a letter from her attorneys, former S.C. Gov. Nikki Haley called on the newly renamed "Haley Voters for Harris" to stop using her name as she "has been clear in her support for Harris' opponent."
title: 'Haley Voters for Harris' pledge to fight on after Nikki Haley says cease and desist
